channel.title: Jejak Peninggalan Sejarah – The Suroboyo Heritage Trail

item.title: Jembatan Merah
item.dc:creator: Joko Winarno
item.description:
<![CDATA[
The Red Bridge was built in the 1890s. The bridge is a link between Jalan Rajawali and Jalan Kembang Jepun. The Red Bridge was built over the Kalimas river. There are at least two versions of the name of the bridge that was built during the Dutch colonial period. The first version relates to the myth of the shark (Sura) and crocodile (Baya) fighting in Kalimas which caused both of them to bleed and gush [â€¦]
The post Jembatan Merah appeared first on The Suroboyo Heritage Trail . ]]>
item.content:encoded:
<![CDATA[
/*! elementor - v3.4.4 - 13-09-2021 */ .elementor-widget-text-editor.elementor-drop-cap-view-stacked .elementor-drop-cap{background-color:#818a91;color:#fff}.elementor-widget-text-editor.elementor-drop-cap-view-framed .elementor-drop-cap{color:#818a91;border:3px solid;background-color:transparent}.elementor-widget-text-editor:not(.elementor-drop-cap-view-default) .elementor-drop-cap{margin-top:8px}.elementor-widget-text-editor:not(.elementor-drop-cap-view-default) .elementor-drop-cap-letter{width:1em;height:1em}.elementor-widget-text-editor .elementor-drop-cap{float:left;text-align:center;line-height:1;font-size:50px}.elementor-widget-text-editor .elementor-drop-cap-letter{display:inline-block}
The Red Bridge was built in the 1890s. The bridge is a link between Jalan Rajawali and Jalan Kembang Jepun. The Red Bridge was built over the Kalimas river. There are at least two versions of the name of the bridge that was built during the Dutch colonial period.
The first version relates to the myth of the shark (Sura) and crocodile (Baya) fighting in Kalimas which caused both of them to bleed and flow through the river. Another version, the name Jembatan Merah was taken to commemorate the Surabaya fighters. Mentioned, in the area there was a fierce battle arek-arek Surabaya against the Allied troops. Around the bridge, Brigadier General Mallaby , leader of the British army; died when a grenade was thrown at his car. Until now this bridge is still well maintained.

item.title: Monumen Resolusi Jihad
item.dc:creator: Joko Winarno
item.description:
<![CDATA[
The Jihad Resolution Monument was inaugurated on October 23, 2011, to commemorate the history of the battle in Surabaya which is inseparable from the role of "NU Jihad Resolution".
The post Monumen Resolution Jihad appeared first on The Suroboyo Heritage Trail . ]]>
item.content:encoded:
<![CDATA[
The history of the battle to defend independence in Surabaya cannot be separated from the role of the "Nahdlatul Ulama (NU) Jihad Resolution" on October 22, 1945. The Jihad Resolution, which is very closely related to the November 10 battle, was initiated in an old building not far from the Heroes Monument. The building is located north of the Heroes Monument, precisely in the village of Bubutan VI/2 Surabaya. The building is now the Office of the Secretariat of the NU Branch Management (PCNU) Surabaya . On October 23, 2011 the place was made a "Jihad Resolution Monument" which was inaugurated by the general chairman of PBNU, Prof. KH. Said Aqil Siradj.
Jihad Resolution Monument
Building History
The building was formerly called Hoofdbestuur NO, a Dutch building built in 1909. Before this building was used by PCNU Surabaya, previously Hoofdbestuur NO was the Office of the Department of Religion (Shubumu) in Surabaya, whose head was KH. Hasyim Asy'ari himself.
Nahdlatul Ulama itself or formerly written as Nahdatul Oelama , abbreviated as NO , means the revival of scholars. The organization founded by the scholars on January 31, 1926/16 Rajab 1344 H2 in Kampung Kertopaten Surabaya.
When it was still called Hoofdbestuur NO
PCNU Secretariat Building Now
About the Resolution of Jihad
The Jihad Resolution was the idea of NU scholars throughout Java and Madura to declare a holy war or jihad against the invaders. The declaration was led directly byKyai Haji Hasyim Asy'ari.
After October 22, 1945, thousands of Kiai and santri came to Surabaya to fight against the invaders. The Jihad resolution was a trigger for the enthusiasm of the Suroboyo and other Indonesian people in Surabaya to fight to defend their homeland. The war of 10 November 1945 became known to history as the biggest battle in Indonesia.
Jihad Resolution

item.title: Monumen Pers Perjuangan Surabaya
item.dc:creator: Joko Winarno
item.description:
<![CDATA[
The Surabaya Struggle Press Monument building is located across the street from the Majapahit Hotel. It used to be the Simpangche Bazaar Store, then it became the Nam Shop and the Kwang Store.
The post Pers Perjuangan Surabaya Monument appeared first on The Suroboyo Heritage Trail . ]]>
item.content:encoded:
<![CDATA[
The Surabaya Struggle Press Monument building is located not far across the road from Hotel Majapahit. In 1898 this building was an ordinary house building. Then in 1900, this building was built into the Simpangsche Bazaar Shop .
Simpangsche Bazaar . shop
Become a Nam Shop & Kwang Store
In 1925 the building was turned into a car shop. Five years later until 1938, this building became the Nam Store and Kwang Store, respectively .
Nam . shop
Kwang shop
Building form between 1940-1945
Press Fighters at the Surabaya Struggle Press Monument
On September 1, 1945 this building was used as the Indonesian News Agency (Antara). A number of names of press fighters during the independence period are enshrined in this monument. Among the rows of names is the name Bung Tomo , who is known as an orator and spreader of the news of the independence of the Republic of Indonesia. This was done to encourage the Suroboyo people not to surrender to the British troops.
Current condition
The post Pers Perjuangan Surabaya Monument appeared first on The Suroboyo Heritage Trail . ]]>

item.title: Tugu Pahlawan
item.dc:creator: Joko Winarno
item.description:
<![CDATA[
Tugu Pahlawan is a monument built to commemorate the services of heroes who fought to defend Indonesia's independence in Surabaya.
The post Tugu Pahlawan appeared first on The Suroboyo Heritage Trail . ]]>
item.content:encoded:
<![CDATA[
Tugu Pahlawan is a monument built to commemorate the services of heroes who fought to defend Indonesia's independence in Surabaya.
Before it was built, during the colonial period in the area there was the Raad Van Justitie building or the court building belonging to the Dutch East Indies Government in Surabaya.
The Raad van Justitie Building Before the Bombings
The Raad van Justitie Building After the Bombings
When the Japanese occupied Indonesia, the building was renamed Kenpetai , and changed its function to become the headquarters of the Japanese army.
It was at that location that on September 23, 1945, the Suroboyo members came to carry out the plan to seize the power of Surabaya from the Japanese Military Government. The building was destroyed by the British army attack.
Current condition
Currently, in the area of the monument, a beautiful garden is built, which is decorated with statues of heroes and various war equipment used during the expulsion of the invaders. In addition, there is also an underground building that is used as a museum. The museum contains various documentation during the battle, before and after 10 November 1945.
To commemorate all these struggles, on November 10, 1951 the First President of the Republic of Indonesia, Soekarno, laid the first stone for the construction of the Heroes Monument. Furthermore, according to the Decree of the Mayor of Surabaya (SK) No. 188.45/251/402.1.04/1945, the area of the Heroes Monument is designated as a Cultural Conservation Building.
Hero Monument Current Condition.
November 10 Museum
The post Tugu Pahlawan appeared first on The Suroboyo Heritage Trail . ]]>
